title: Thanksgiving Feast Flicks: Family Classics and Road-Trip Comedies to Gobble Up After Dinner
description: From family classics to laugh-out-loud comedies, here are the ultimate Thanksgiving movies to enjoy after the feast! The post Thanksgiving Feast Flicks: Family Classics and Road-Trip Comedies to Gobble Up After Dinner appeared first on TV Fanatic.
author: Lisa Babick
excerpt: From family classics to laugh-out-loud comedies, here are the ultimate Thanksgiving movies to enjoy after the feast!
text: Once the plates are cleared and the leftovers are packed, it’s time to settle in for a Thanksgiving movie tradition. After all, there’s no better way to wind down than with a film that brings a little extra joy to the holiday. From heartwarming family classics to laugh-out-loud road-trip comedies, these films capture the essence of the season — family, friendship, and maybe a little holiday chaos. (20th Century Fox/Screenshot) Perfect for unwinding with loved ones, this list has something for everyone to enjoy after the feast, keeping the holiday spirit alive with laughs, nostalgia, and a touch of adventure. So grab a cozy spot, pass the popcorn, and let the post-Thanksgiving movie marathon begin! Classic Family Favorites These timeless films bring warmth, nostalgia, and a touch of magic to the Thanksgiving season. Perfect for all ages, they’re the kind of movies that make you feel right at home, whether you’re watching them for the first time or the hundredth. The Wizard of Oz (Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer/Screenshot) Nothing says family tradition like The Wizard of Oz, a classic that has captured the hearts of audiences for generations. This timeless journey follows Dorothy (Judy Garland) and her unlikely friends down the Yellow Brick Road, reminding us of the power of friendship, bravery, and self-discovery. Its colorful world, unforgettable songs, and iconic characters make it a perfect post-feast watch for families looking to escape to a magical place. The Wizard of Oz brings nostalgia, wonder, and a dose of classic movie magic that’s as comforting as a slice of pumpkin pie. Watch The Wizard of Oz Online Charlie Brown Thanksgiving (CBS/Screenshot) Charlie Brown Thanksgiving is a holiday staple that brings charm and heart to the Thanksgiving season. In true Peanuts fashion, the story follows Charlie Brown’s attempt to host an impromptu Thanksgiving dinner, complete with buttered toast, popcorn, and jelly beans. With its simple animation style and heartfelt moments, this special captures the spirit of togetherness and gratitude, even when things don’t go as planned. Charlie Brown Thanksgiving is the perfect way to wind down with family and celebrate the holiday with a big helping of nostalgia and Peanuts wisdom. Watch Charlie Brown Thanksgiving Online Miracle on 34th Street (1947) (20th Century Fox/Screenshot) Miracle on 34th Street is one of those timeless classics that captures the pure wonder of Christmas and the magic of belief that begins its tale before Macy’s Thanksgiving parade. The story follows young Susan (Natalie Wood), a little girl who’s been taught not to believe in fairy tales — until she meets Kris Kringle, a man who claims to be the real Santa Claus. As Kris spreads kindness throughout New York City, he defends his identity in court, where the true spirit of Christmas takes center stage. The iconic moment when bags of children’s letters to Santa are brought in to prove Kris’s identity is unforgettable, reminding us that sometimes, it’s okay to believe in a little magic. This movie brings warmth, hope, and holiday cheer in a way that makes it a perfect watch right after Thanksgiving dinner. Watch Miracle on 34th Street Online March of the Wooden Soldiers (Babes in Toyland) (Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer/Screensho) March of the Wooden Soldiers, also known as Babes in Toyland, is a holiday classic that combines adventure, fantasy, and timeless charm. Starring the iconic comedy duo Laurel and Hardy, the story takes place in a magical Toyland, where Mother Goose characters come to life, and wooden soldiers stand tall against the evil Barnaby. With its whimsical sets and old-school humor, this film offers a nostalgic trip back to simpler times, making it a cozy, family-friendly choice for Thanksgiving. March of the Wooden Soldiers brings laughter and holiday spirit, making it a memorable way to begin the festive season. Watch Babes in Toyland Online Little Women (Columbia Pictures/Screenshot) Little Women is a heartwarming tale that brings the bonds of family, love, and resilience to life. Following the March sisters — Jo, Meg, Beth, and Amy — through their coming-of-age journeys, this adaptation captures the warmth and struggles of a close-knit family during the Civil War. With themes of sisterhood, self-discovery, and generosity, Little Women is the perfect movie to watch with loved ones after a Thanksgiving feast. Its timeless story and emotional depth remind us to cherish those around us, making it an ideal start to the holiday season. Watch Little Women Online Holiday Inn (Paramount/Screenshot) Holiday Inn is a classic musical that brings holiday cheer in style, featuring the iconic pairing of Bing Crosby and Fred Astaire. Set in a cozy inn that opens only for holidays, the film follows a love triangle filled with romance, song, and dance. With its memorable numbers — including the first appearance of the beloved song White Christmas — Holiday Inn captures the magic of holiday traditions. Its warm, festive atmosphere makes it a perfect choice to start the holiday season after Thanksgiving dinner, adding a touch of nostalgia and elegance to the evening. Watch Holiday Inn Online A Christmas Story (Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer/Screenshot) A Christmas Story is a holiday tradition that captures the joys and mishaps of childhood in all their festive glory. Following young Ralphie Parker’s (Peter Billingsley) relentless quest for a Red Ryder BB gun, this movie brings us unforgettable moments that we revisit year after year. Who can forget Ralphie’s friend getting his tongue stuck to the icy pole, the infamous leg lamp in the living room window, or Ralphie’s bundled-up brother barely able to move in his winter gear? Each scene is filled with humor and nostalgia, making A Christmas Story a beloved must-watch after Thanksgiving. It’s a heartwarming way to welcome the holiday season, bringing laughter and timeless memories for the whole family. Watch A Christmas Story Online Thanksgiving-Themed Flicks and Specials (Paramount Pictures/Screenshots) These movies and specials embrace Thanksgiving in all its forms, from the joys of gathering together to the inevitable holiday mishaps. These stories highlight the spirit of gratitude, family, and sometimes the chaos of family gatherings. They’re a perfect way to sit back, relax, and celebrate the season. Alice’s Restaurant Available for purchase on DVD (United Artists/Screenshot) Alice’s Restaurant is a one-of-a-kind Thanksgiving film that blends humor, counterculture, and social commentary. Based on Arlo Guthrie’s famous song, this film follows his real-life experience of being arrested for littering after Thanksgiving dinner — a minor incident that spirals into a satirical look at authority, activism, and freedom. Set in the 1960s, the film captures the rebellious spirit of the time, making it both nostalgic and thought-provoking. With its quirky humor and unconventional storytelling, Alice’s Restaurant is perfect for those who want something a little offbeat after their Thanksgiving feast. Friendsgiving (Red Hour Films/Screenshot) Friendsgiving is a modern twist on Thanksgiving that celebrates the ups and downs of gathering with friends instead of family. This comedy follows Molly (Malin Ackerman) and Abby (Kat Dennings) as they try to host a relaxed Thanksgiving meal. However, unexpected guests, awkward conversations, and plenty of hilarious mishaps cause chaos. With a mix of humor, heart, and a dash of holiday dysfunction, Friendsgiving captures the spirit of embracing a chosen family and finding joy in the madness. It’s a relatable, laugh-out-loud choice for anyone who’s shared a memorable Friendsgiving meal. Watch Friendsgiving Online What’s Cooking? (Lionsgate Films, Trimark Pictures/Screenshot) What’s Cooking? offers a fresh perspective on Thanksgiving, following four diverse families in Los Angeles as they gather for the holiday. Each family brings its own cultural traditions and struggles, from love and loyalty to intergenerational clashes. As the families prepare and share their meals, the film explores themes of identity, acceptance, and the bonds that unite us all. What’s Cooking? is a heartfelt, food-filled celebration of diversity that highlights the power of community and the beauty of family in all its forms. It’s a perfect watch for those who appreciate the many flavors of Thanksgiving. Watch What's Cooking Online Garfield’s Thanksgiving (CBS/Screenshot) In Garfield’s Thanksgiving, everyone’s favorite lasagna-loving cat finds himself facing a Thanksgiving nightmare — dieting. When Jon’s love interest, veterinarian Liz, tells him that Garfield needs to cut back, Garfield’s holiday feast dreams seem dashed. But with Jon’s help (and a little feline mischief), Thanksgiving turns into a memorable and food-filled celebration. With its humor, classic Garfield antics, and heartwarming moments, Garfield’s Thanksgiving is a cozy, light-hearted choice that’s perfect for a post-dinner laugh with family. Watch Garfield's Thanksgiving Online Pieces of April (Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer/Screenshot) Pieces of April is a heartfelt indie film that captures the chaos and warmth of a Thanksgiving family gathering. April (Katie Holmes), the family’s black sheep, invites her estranged relatives to her tiny New York apartment for Thanksgiving dinner. But with a broken oven and quirky neighbors lending a hand, things quickly go awry. As her family makes their way to the city, tensions simmer, but so does an undercurrent of love and forgiveness. With humor and raw emotion, Pieces of April explores family dynamics and the power of second chances, making it an intimate, relatable choice for the holiday Watch Pieces of April Online Scent of a Woman (Universal Pictures/Screenshot) Scent of a Woman is a powerful drama that blends Thanksgiving themes with a journey of self-discovery. The story follows prep school student Charlie (Chris O’Donnell), who agrees to look after retired, blind Army officer Lt. Col. Frank Slade (Al Pacino) over Thanksgiving weekend. What begins as a simple job turns into a life-changing experience as Frank takes Charlie on a whirlwind tour of New York City, teaching him about courage, integrity, and the importance of standing up for oneself. Al Pacino’s Oscar-winning performance is intense and deep, making Scent of a Woman a compelling, thought-provoking film perfect for a post-Thanksgiving watch. Watch Scent of a Woman Online Home for the Holidays (Paramount Pictures/Screenshot) Home for the Holidays is the ultimate Thanksgiving dramedy, capturing the highs and lows of a family reunion in all its messy glory. Claudia (Holly Hunter), recently unemployed and reeling from her daughter’s decision not to join her for Thanksgiving, returns home to face her quirky, unpredictable family. With family arguments, secrets, and awkward moments galore, the film highlights the chaos and comfort of family gatherings. Directed by Jodie Foster and featuring an all-star cast, Home for the Holidays is a relatable, humorous look at family dysfunction. It’s perfect for anyone who knows that the holidays aren’t always picture-perfect. Watch Home for the Holidays Online Road-Trip and Dysfunctional Family Comedies (Warner Bros./Screenshot) Nothing captures the chaos of family and holiday travel like a good road trip or dysfunctional family comedy. These films bring laughs and relatable moments, reminding us that no family is perfect. Sometimes, the most memorable journeys are the ones that go completely off the rails. Planes, Trains, and Automobiles (Paramount Pictures/Screenshot) Planes, Trains, and Automobiles is a Thanksgiving comedy classic that captures the mayhem of holiday travel with unforgettable humor and heart. The story follows uptight marketing executive Neal Page (Steve Martin) as he desperately tries to get home for Thanksgiving. But he ends up getting stuck with an overbearing, well-meaning shower curtain ring salesman, Del Griffith (John Candy). What begins as a clash of personalities evolves into an unlikely friendship as the two navigate a series of travel disasters. With hilarious misadventures and a heartwarming ending, Planes, Trains, and Automobiles is a must-watch for anyone who’s experienced holiday travel chaos and values the importance of kindness. Watch Planes, Trains and Automobiles Online Dutch Available to purchase on DVD (Twentieth Century Fox) Dutch is a Thanksgiving road-trip comedy that’s equal parts heart and humor. The story follows Dutch Dooley (Ed O’Neill), a rough-around-the-edges guy who volunteers to drive his girlfriend’s spoiled son, Doyle, home for Thanksgiving. The journey quickly spirals into a series of misadventures, with Dutch and Doyle clashing in a battle of wills that’s both hilarious and heartfelt. As they’re forced to rely on each other, their bond slowly shifts from animosity to understanding. Dutch is a funny, feel-good story about family and the unexpected connections that can happen on the road home. National Lampoon’s Christmas Vacation (Warner Bros./Screenshot) National Lampoon’s Christmas Vacation is a holiday comedy classic that brings the Griswold family’s over-the-top holiday plans to chaotic life. Clark Griswold (Chevy Chase) is determined to have the “perfect” Christmas, but everything that can go wrong does, from tangled lights to unexpected family drama. With unforgettable moments like the infamous turkey dinner and a surprise visit from Cousin Eddie (Randy Quaid), the film captures the hilarity of holiday mishaps and family dysfunction. Christmas Vacation is an ideal post-Thanksgiving watch, kicking off the season with laughs and relatable family chaos. Watch National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation Online Little Miss Sunshine (Big Beach, Bona Fide Productions/Screenshot) Little Miss Sunshine is a quirky, heartfelt road-trip comedy about family, resilience, and the unexpected moments that bring us closer together. The dysfunctional Hoover family embarks on a chaotic cross-country journey in a rickety VW bus so young Olive (Abigail Breslin) can compete in a children’s beauty pageant. Along the way, each family member confronts their own struggles, leading to moments of humor, tension, and genuine connection. With its unique characters and touching humor, Little Miss Sunshine celebrates the messy beauty of family. It’s an ideal watch after Thanksgiving, bringing laughter and warmth to the holiday season. Watch Little Miss Sunshine Online Grumpy Old Men (Warner Bros. Pictures) Grumpy Old Men is a classic comedy that brings the charm of a small-town rivalry to life. The film follows John (Jack Lemmon) and Max (Walter Matthau), two lifelong neighbors whose friendship is fueled by constant bickering and one-upmanship. When an attractive new neighbor moves in, their rivalry intensifies, leading to hilarious schemes and grudging camaraderie. Set against a cozy, wintery backdrop, Grumpy Old Men is packed with humor and heart, capturing the joys and frustrations of growing older. It’s a light-hearted, feel-good choice for Thanksgiving, perfect for anyone who loves a good laugh — and a little friendly competition. Watch Grumpy Old Men Online The Family Stone (20th Century Fox/Screenshot) The Family Stone is a heartfelt dramedy that dives into the complexities of family dynamics during the holidays. When uptight Meredith (Sarah Jessica Parker) joins her boyfriend Everett’s (Dermot Mulroney) bohemian family for Christmas, tensions run high as she struggles to fit in with the free-spirited Stone clan. With humor, misunderstandings, and plenty of heart, the film explores themes of acceptance, love, and letting go of expectations. Featuring an ensemble cast, The Family Stone beautifully captures the messiness and warmth of family gatherings. It’s a perfect post-Thanksgiving watch that reminds us of the importance of connection, even when things don’t go as planned. Watch The Family Stone Online Tower Heist (Universal Pictures/Screenshot) Tower Heist combines comedy, action, and a bit of Robin Hood spirit in a high-stakes caper that’s perfect for post-Thanksgiving entertainment. When a luxury apartment building’s employees discover they’ve been swindled out of their pensions by a wealthy resident, they band together to pull off a heist to take back what’s theirs. With a mix of clever schemes, hilarious mishaps, and an ensemble cast led by Ben Stiller and Eddie Murphy, Tower Heist is a fun, fast-paced adventure. It’s a film that serves up laughs and just the right amount of holiday-season mischief. Watch Tower Heist Online Quirky and Unconventional Picks (United Artists/Screens) For those who like their holiday viewing a little offbeat, these films bring a unique twist to Thanksgiving. From imaginative adventures to dark humor, these unconventional choices offer something different. They’re perfect for families looking to mix it up after the big feast. Fantastic Mr. Fox (20th Century Fox/Screenshot) Fantastic Mr. Fox is a visually stunning, witty adventure that combines Wes Anderson’s unique style with Roald Dahl’s classic story. The film follows the clever Mr. Fox (voiced by George Clooney) as he outsmarts a trio of ruthless farmers to provide for his family. It celebrates family, friendship, and resilience. With its meticulous stop-motion animation, quirky humor, and endearing characters, Fantastic Mr. Fox is a charming and cozy choice for Thanksgiving. Its autumnal palette and clever storyline make it a fun watch for all ages, bringing warmth, laughter, and a dash of wild spirit to the holiday season. Watch Fantastic Mr. Fox Online Addams Family Values (Paramount Pictures/Screenshot) Addams Family Values brings dark humor and holiday spirit with a delightfully twisted twist on family and togetherness. When the Addams family welcomes a new baby, they hire a scheming nanny who quickly turns their world upside down. Meanwhile, Wednesday (Christina Ricci) and Pugsley (Jimmy Workman) are sent to a cheery summer camp where they hilariously clash with the “normal” kids. Packed with sharp wit, macabre laughs, and iconic performances, Addams Family Values is a perfect post-Thanksgiving treat. It’s a playful reminder that family love comes in all forms, even when it’s a bit spooky. Watch Fantastic Mr. Fox Online The Ice Storm (20th Century Fox/Screenshot) The Ice Storm is a haunting drama that explores the fractures within two suburban families over a chilly Thanksgiving weekend in the 1970s. Set against a backdrop of social change and quiet turmoil, the film delves into themes of infidelity, loneliness, and disillusionment, all set within a community seemingly frozen by both the weather and their own choices. With stunning cinematography and powerful performances, The Ice Storm offers a thought-provoking contrast to the warmth of Thanksgiving. It’s a beautifully crafted, introspective film for viewers in the mood for something deeper and more reflective. Watch The Ice Storm Online Rocky (United Artists/Screenshot) Rocky is the ultimate underdog story, filled with grit, resilience, and the relentless drive to keep fighting for your dreams. The story follows small-time boxer Rocky Balboa (Sylvester Stallone) as he’s given a once-in-a-lifetime shot at the world heavyweight title, squaring off against the champion, Apollo Creed. With unforgettable training montages, an iconic soundtrack, and a heartfelt Thanksgiving dinner scene that kicks off Rocky’s romance with Adrian, this film is so much more than a boxing movie — it’s a tale of perseverance and heart. Wrapping up Thanksgiving with Rocky is a perfect reminder that no matter the odds, it’s worth going the distance. Watch Rocky Online The Last Waltz (United Artists/Screenshot) The Last Waltz is a legendary concert film that captures the farewell performance of The Band in 1976, directed by Martin Scorsese. This documentary, which features iconic performances from music legends like Bob Dylan, Joni Mitchell, and Neil Young, is a feast for music lovers. It blends raw performances with intimate backstage moments. More than just a concert film, The Last Waltz celebrates the spirit of collaboration, creativity, and friendship. For Thanksgiving, it’s a perfect choice to unwind with family, taking in the magic of music and the legacy of an unforgettable era. Watch The Last Waltz Online Keep the Holiday Spirit Rolling (CBS/Screenshot) Thanksgiving might be winding down, but the cozy movie marathon doesn’t have to! These films capture the season’s charm, humor, and heart, making them perfect for family time or unwinding solo. Do you have a favorite Thanksgiving or holiday movie tradition? Share your go-to post-feast flicks in the comments, and let’s keep the holiday spirit alive!
html:
Once the plates are cleared and the leftovers are packed, it’s time to settle in for a Thanksgiving movie tradition.

After all, there’s no better way to wind down than with a film that brings a little extra joy to the holiday.

From heartwarming family classics to laugh-out-loud road-trip comedies, these films capture the essence of the season — family, friendship, and maybe a little holiday chaos.

Perfect for unwinding with loved ones, this list has something for everyone to enjoy after the feast, keeping the holiday spirit alive with laughs, nostalgia, and a touch of adventure.

So grab a cozy spot, pass the popcorn, and let the post-Thanksgiving movie marathon begin!

Classic Family Favorites

These timeless films bring warmth, nostalgia, and a touch of magic to the Thanksgiving season.

Perfect for all ages, they’re the kind of movies that make you feel right at home, whether you’re watching them for the first time or the hundredth.

The Wizard of Oz

Nothing says family tradition like The Wizard of Oz, a classic that has captured the hearts of audiences for generations.

This timeless journey follows Dorothy (Judy Garland) and her unlikely friends down the Yellow Brick Road, reminding us of the power of friendship, bravery, and self-discovery.

Its colorful world, unforgettable songs, and iconic characters make it a perfect post-feast watch for families looking to escape to a magical place.

The Wizard of Oz brings nostalgia, wonder, and a dose of classic movie magic that’s as comforting as a slice of pumpkin pie.

Watch The Wizard of Oz Online

Charlie Brown Thanksgiving

Charlie Brown Thanksgiving is a holiday staple that brings charm and heart to the Thanksgiving season.

In true Peanuts fashion, the story follows Charlie Brown’s attempt to host an impromptu Thanksgiving dinner, complete with buttered toast, popcorn, and jelly beans.

With its simple animation style and heartfelt moments, this special captures the spirit of togetherness and gratitude, even when things don’t go as planned.

Charlie Brown Thanksgiving is the perfect way to wind down with family and celebrate the holiday with a big helping of nostalgia and Peanuts wisdom.

Watch Charlie Brown Thanksgiving Online

Miracle on 34th Street (1947)

Miracle on 34th Street is one of those timeless classics that captures the pure wonder of Christmas and the magic of belief that begins its tale before Macy’s Thanksgiving parade.

The story follows young Susan (Natalie Wood), a little girl who’s been taught not to believe in fairy tales — until she meets Kris Kringle, a man who claims to be the real Santa Claus.

As Kris spreads kindness throughout New York City, he defends his identity in court, where the true spirit of Christmas takes center stage.

The iconic moment when bags of children’s letters to Santa are brought in to prove Kris’s identity is unforgettable, reminding us that sometimes, it’s okay to believe in a little magic.

This movie brings warmth, hope, and holiday cheer in a way that makes it a perfect watch right after Thanksgiving dinner.

Watch Miracle on 34th Street Online

March of the Wooden Soldiers (Babes in Toyland)

March of the Wooden Soldiers, also known as Babes in Toyland, is a holiday classic that combines adventure, fantasy, and timeless charm.

Starring the iconic comedy duo Laurel and Hardy, the story takes place in a magical Toyland, where Mother Goose characters come to life, and wooden soldiers stand tall against the evil Barnaby.

With its whimsical sets and old-school humor, this film offers a nostalgic trip back to simpler times, making it a cozy, family-friendly choice for Thanksgiving.

March of the Wooden Soldiers brings laughter and holiday spirit, making it a memorable way to begin the festive season.

Watch Babes in Toyland Online

Little Women

Little Women is a heartwarming tale that brings the bonds of family, love, and resilience to life.

Following the March sisters — Jo, Meg, Beth, and Amy — through their coming-of-age journeys, this adaptation captures the warmth and struggles of a close-knit family during the Civil War.

With themes of sisterhood, self-discovery, and generosity, Little Women is the perfect movie to watch with loved ones after a Thanksgiving feast.

Its timeless story and emotional depth remind us to cherish those around us, making it an ideal start to the holiday season.

Watch Little Women Online

Holiday Inn

Holiday Inn is a classic musical that brings holiday cheer in style, featuring the iconic pairing of Bing Crosby and Fred Astaire.

Set in a cozy inn that opens only for holidays, the film follows a love triangle filled with romance, song, and dance.

With its memorable numbers — including the first appearance of the beloved song White Christmas — Holiday Inn captures the magic of holiday traditions.

Its warm, festive atmosphere makes it a perfect choice to start the holiday season after Thanksgiving dinner, adding a touch of nostalgia and elegance to the evening.

Watch Holiday Inn Online

A Christmas Story

A Christmas Story is a holiday tradition that captures the joys and mishaps of childhood in all their festive glory.

Following young Ralphie Parker’s (Peter Billingsley) relentless quest for a Red Ryder BB gun, this movie brings us unforgettable moments that we revisit year after year.

Who can forget Ralphie’s friend getting his tongue stuck to the icy pole, the infamous leg lamp in the living room window, or Ralphie’s bundled-up brother barely able to move in his winter gear?

Each scene is filled with humor and nostalgia, making A Christmas Story a beloved must-watch after Thanksgiving.

It’s a heartwarming way to welcome the holiday season, bringing laughter and timeless memories for the whole family.

Watch A Christmas Story Online

Thanksgiving-Themed Flicks and Specials

These movies and specials embrace Thanksgiving in all its forms, from the joys of gathering together to the inevitable holiday mishaps.

These stories highlight the spirit of gratitude, family, and sometimes the chaos of family gatherings.

They’re a perfect way to sit back, relax, and celebrate the season.

Alice’s Restaurant

Available for purchase on DVD

Alice’s Restaurant is a one-of-a-kind Thanksgiving film that blends humor, counterculture, and social commentary.

Based on Arlo Guthrie’s famous song, this film follows his real-life experience of being arrested for littering after Thanksgiving dinner — a minor incident that spirals into a satirical look at authority, activism, and freedom.

Set in the 1960s, the film captures the rebellious spirit of the time, making it both nostalgic and thought-provoking.

With its quirky humor and unconventional storytelling, Alice’s Restaurant is perfect for those who want something a little offbeat after their Thanksgiving feast.

Friendsgiving

Friendsgiving is a modern twist on Thanksgiving that celebrates the ups and downs of gathering with friends instead of family.

This comedy follows Molly (Malin Ackerman) and Abby (Kat Dennings) as they try to host a relaxed Thanksgiving meal. However, unexpected guests, awkward conversations, and plenty of hilarious mishaps cause chaos.

With a mix of humor, heart, and a dash of holiday dysfunction, Friendsgiving captures the spirit of embracing a chosen family and finding joy in the madness.

It’s a relatable, laugh-out-loud choice for anyone who’s shared a memorable Friendsgiving meal.

Watch Friendsgiving Online

What’s Cooking?

What’s Cooking? offers a fresh perspective on Thanksgiving, following four diverse families in Los Angeles as they gather for the holiday.

Each family brings its own cultural traditions and struggles, from love and loyalty to intergenerational clashes.

As the families prepare and share their meals, the film explores themes of identity, acceptance, and the bonds that unite us all.

What’s Cooking? is a heartfelt, food-filled celebration of diversity that highlights the power of community and the beauty of family in all its forms.

It’s a perfect watch for those who appreciate the many flavors of Thanksgiving.

Watch What's Cooking Online

Garfield’s Thanksgiving

In Garfield’s Thanksgiving, everyone’s favorite lasagna-loving cat finds himself facing a Thanksgiving nightmare — dieting.

When Jon’s love interest, veterinarian Liz, tells him that Garfield needs to cut back, Garfield’s holiday feast dreams seem dashed.

But with Jon’s help (and a little feline mischief), Thanksgiving turns into a memorable and food-filled celebration.

With its humor, classic Garfield antics, and heartwarming moments, Garfield’s Thanksgiving is a cozy, light-hearted choice that’s perfect for a post-dinner laugh with family.

Watch Garfield's Thanksgiving Online

Pieces of April

Pieces of April is a heartfelt indie film that captures the chaos and warmth of a Thanksgiving family gathering.

April (Katie Holmes), the family’s black sheep, invites her estranged relatives to her tiny New York apartment for Thanksgiving dinner.

But with a broken oven and quirky neighbors lending a hand, things quickly go awry.

As her family makes their way to the city, tensions simmer, but so does an undercurrent of love and forgiveness.

With humor and raw emotion, Pieces of April explores family dynamics and the power of second chances, making it an intimate, relatable choice for the holiday

Watch Pieces of April Online

Scent of a Woman

Scent of a Woman is a powerful drama that blends Thanksgiving themes with a journey of self-discovery.

The story follows prep school student Charlie (Chris O’Donnell), who agrees to look after retired, blind Army officer Lt. Col. Frank Slade (Al Pacino) over Thanksgiving weekend.

What begins as a simple job turns into a life-changing experience as Frank takes Charlie on a whirlwind tour of New York City, teaching him about courage, integrity, and the importance of standing up for oneself.

Al Pacino’s Oscar-winning performance is intense and deep, making Scent of a Woman a compelling, thought-provoking film perfect for a post-Thanksgiving watch.

Watch Scent of a Woman Online

Home for the Holidays

Home for the Holidays is the ultimate Thanksgiving dramedy, capturing the highs and lows of a family reunion in all its messy glory.

Claudia (Holly Hunter), recently unemployed and reeling from her daughter’s decision not to join her for Thanksgiving, returns home to face her quirky, unpredictable family.

With family arguments, secrets, and awkward moments galore, the film highlights the chaos and comfort of family gatherings.

Directed by Jodie Foster and featuring an all-star cast, Home for the Holidays is a relatable, humorous look at family dysfunction.

It’s perfect for anyone who knows that the holidays aren’t always picture-perfect.

Watch Home for the Holidays Online

Road-Trip and Dysfunctional Family Comedies

Nothing captures the chaos of family and holiday travel like a good road trip or dysfunctional family comedy.

These films bring laughs and relatable moments, reminding us that no family is perfect.

Sometimes, the most memorable journeys are the ones that go completely off the rails.

Planes, Trains, and Automobiles

Planes, Trains, and Automobiles is a Thanksgiving comedy classic that captures the mayhem of holiday travel with unforgettable humor and heart.

The story follows uptight marketing executive Neal Page (Steve Martin) as he desperately tries to get home for Thanksgiving.

But he ends up getting stuck with an overbearing, well-meaning shower curtain ring salesman, Del Griffith (John Candy).

What begins as a clash of personalities evolves into an unlikely friendship as the two navigate a series of travel disasters.

With hilarious misadventures and a heartwarming ending, Planes, Trains, and Automobiles is a must-watch for anyone who’s experienced holiday travel chaos and values the importance of kindness.

Watch Planes, Trains and Automobiles Online

Dutch

Available to purchase on DVD

Dutch is a Thanksgiving road-trip comedy that’s equal parts heart and humor.

The story follows Dutch Dooley (Ed O’Neill), a rough-around-the-edges guy who volunteers to drive his girlfriend’s spoiled son, Doyle, home for Thanksgiving.

The journey quickly spirals into a series of misadventures, with Dutch and Doyle clashing in a battle of wills that’s both hilarious and heartfelt.

As they’re forced to rely on each other, their bond slowly shifts from animosity to understanding.

Dutch is a funny, feel-good story about family and the unexpected connections that can happen on the road home.

National Lampoon’s Christmas Vacation

National Lampoon’s Christmas Vacation is a holiday comedy classic that brings the Griswold family’s over-the-top holiday plans to chaotic life.

Clark Griswold (Chevy Chase) is determined to have the “perfect” Christmas, but everything that can go wrong does, from tangled lights to unexpected family drama.

With unforgettable moments like the infamous turkey dinner and a surprise visit from Cousin Eddie (Randy Quaid), the film captures the hilarity of holiday mishaps and family dysfunction.

Christmas Vacation is an ideal post-Thanksgiving watch, kicking off the season with laughs and relatable family chaos.

Watch National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation Online

Little Miss Sunshine

Little Miss Sunshine is a quirky, heartfelt road-trip comedy about family, resilience, and the unexpected moments that bring us closer together.

The dysfunctional Hoover family embarks on a chaotic cross-country journey in a rickety VW bus so young Olive (Abigail Breslin) can compete in a children’s beauty pageant.

Along the way, each family member confronts their own struggles, leading to moments of humor, tension, and genuine connection.

With its unique characters and touching humor, Little Miss Sunshine celebrates the messy beauty of family.

It’s an ideal watch after Thanksgiving, bringing laughter and warmth to the holiday season.

Watch Little Miss Sunshine Online

Grumpy Old Men

Grumpy Old Men is a classic comedy that brings the charm of a small-town rivalry to life.

The film follows John (Jack Lemmon) and Max (Walter Matthau), two lifelong neighbors whose friendship is fueled by constant bickering and one-upmanship.

When an attractive new neighbor moves in, their rivalry intensifies, leading to hilarious schemes and grudging camaraderie.

Set against a cozy, wintery backdrop, Grumpy Old Men is packed with humor and heart, capturing the joys and frustrations of growing older.

It’s a light-hearted, feel-good choice for Thanksgiving, perfect for anyone who loves a good laugh — and a little friendly competition.

Watch Grumpy Old Men Online

The Family Stone

The Family Stone is a heartfelt dramedy that dives into the complexities of family dynamics during the holidays.

When uptight Meredith (Sarah Jessica Parker) joins her boyfriend Everett’s (Dermot Mulroney) bohemian family for Christmas, tensions run high as she struggles to fit in with the free-spirited Stone clan.

With humor, misunderstandings, and plenty of heart, the film explores themes of acceptance, love, and letting go of expectations.

Featuring an ensemble cast, The Family Stone beautifully captures the messiness and warmth of family gatherings.

It’s a perfect post-Thanksgiving watch that reminds us of the importance of connection, even when things don’t go as planned.

Watch The Family Stone Online

Tower Heist

Tower Heist combines comedy, action, and a bit of Robin Hood spirit in a high-stakes caper that’s perfect for post-Thanksgiving entertainment.

When a luxury apartment building’s employees discover they’ve been swindled out of their pensions by a wealthy resident, they band together to pull off a heist to take back what’s theirs.

With a mix of clever schemes, hilarious mishaps, and an ensemble cast led by Ben Stiller and Eddie Murphy, Tower Heist is a fun, fast-paced adventure.

It’s a film that serves up laughs and just the right amount of holiday-season mischief.

Watch Tower Heist Online

Quirky and Unconventional Picks

For those who like their holiday viewing a little offbeat, these films bring a unique twist to Thanksgiving.

From imaginative adventures to dark humor, these unconventional choices offer something different.

They’re perfect for families looking to mix it up after the big feast.

Fantastic Mr. Fox

Fantastic Mr. Fox is a visually stunning, witty adventure that combines Wes Anderson’s unique style with Roald Dahl’s classic story.

The film follows the clever Mr. Fox (voiced by George Clooney) as he outsmarts a trio of ruthless farmers to provide for his family. It celebrates family, friendship, and resilience.

With its meticulous stop-motion animation, quirky humor, and endearing characters, Fantastic Mr. Fox is a charming and cozy choice for Thanksgiving.

Its autumnal palette and clever storyline make it a fun watch for all ages, bringing warmth, laughter, and a dash of wild spirit to the holiday season.

Watch Fantastic Mr. Fox Online

Addams Family Values

Addams Family Values brings dark humor and holiday spirit with a delightfully twisted twist on family and togetherness.

When the Addams family welcomes a new baby, they hire a scheming nanny who quickly turns their world upside down.

Meanwhile, Wednesday (Christina Ricci) and Pugsley (Jimmy Workman) are sent to a cheery summer camp where they hilariously clash with the “normal” kids.

Packed with sharp wit, macabre laughs, and iconic performances, Addams Family Values is a perfect post-Thanksgiving treat.

It’s a playful reminder that family love comes in all forms, even when it’s a bit spooky.

Watch Fantastic Mr. Fox Online

The Ice Storm

The Ice Storm is a haunting drama that explores the fractures within two suburban families over a chilly Thanksgiving weekend in the 1970s.

Set against a backdrop of social change and quiet turmoil, the film delves into themes of infidelity, loneliness, and disillusionment, all set within a community seemingly frozen by both the weather and their own choices.

With stunning cinematography and powerful performances, The Ice Storm offers a thought-provoking contrast to the warmth of Thanksgiving.

It’s a beautifully crafted, introspective film for viewers in the mood for something deeper and more reflective.

Watch The Ice Storm Online

Rocky

Rocky is the ultimate underdog story, filled with grit, resilience, and the relentless drive to keep fighting for your dreams.

The story follows small-time boxer Rocky Balboa (Sylvester Stallone) as he’s given a once-in-a-lifetime shot at the world heavyweight title, squaring off against the champion, Apollo Creed.

With unforgettable training montages, an iconic soundtrack, and a heartfelt Thanksgiving dinner scene that kicks off Rocky’s romance with Adrian, this film is so much more than a boxing movie — it’s a tale of perseverance and heart.

Wrapping up Thanksgiving with Rocky is a perfect reminder that no matter the odds, it’s worth going the distance.

Watch Rocky Online

The Last Waltz

The Last Waltz is a legendary concert film that captures the farewell performance of The Band in 1976, directed by Martin Scorsese.

This documentary, which features iconic performances from music legends like Bob Dylan, Joni Mitchell, and Neil Young, is a feast for music lovers. It blends raw performances with intimate backstage moments.

More than just a concert film, The Last Waltz celebrates the spirit of collaboration, creativity, and friendship.

For Thanksgiving, it’s a perfect choice to unwind with family, taking in the magic of music and the legacy of an unforgettable era.

Watch The Last Waltz Online

Keep the Holiday Spirit Rolling

Thanksgiving might be winding down, but the cozy movie marathon doesn’t have to!

These films capture the season’s charm, humor, and heart, making them perfect for family time or unwinding solo.

Do you have a favorite Thanksgiving or holiday movie tradition?
